body: hi i was redstoning in minecraft and testing what repeaters could go through and i placed a repeater to see if it could be gone through,but the way i placed it, it made a bedrock repeater i was doing it in 1.8 and i was using no mods
body_tagged: hi i was redstoning in minecraft and testing what repeaters could go through and i placed a repeater to see if it could be gone through,but the way i placed it, it made a bedrock repeater i was doing it in 1.8 and i was using no mods
title: minecraft bedrock repeater

replies.body:

Looks like a texture error, reinstall your textures

replies.body: It's called repeater locking. If you enter an Input, lock the repeater, it will output it aslong as the repeater is locked and doesn't change it's state. If you unlock the repeater the signal will just go through. Very useful for very compact D-Flip-Flops
replies.body_tagged: It's called repeater locking. If you enter an Input, lock the repeater, it will output it aslong as the repeater is locked and doesn't change it's state. If you unlock the repeater the signal will just go through. Very useful for very compact D-Flip-Flops
